org.kiji.schema.layout
Class ColumnReaderSpec

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.layout.ColumnReaderSpec
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
@ApiAudience.Public
@ApiStability.Experimental
public final class ColumnReaderSpec
extends Object
implements Serializable

Specification of read properties applied when decoding cells from a column in a Kiji table.

This class provides several factory methods to specify read properties applied when decoding a column in a Kiji table.

Note: this object assumes that Avro Schema objects are never mutated. In particular, one should never modify the properties of a Schema object (eg. using JsonProperties.addProp(String, String) after it has been constructed.

ColumnReaderSpec Implements Serializable because KijiDataRequest requires it. Do not rely on Java serialization, it will eventually be replaced by Avro, see SCHEMA-589.

See Also:

avroReaderSchemaSpecific

public static ColumnReaderSpec avroReaderSchemaSpecific(Class<? extends org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificRecord> readerSchemaClass)
                                                 throws InvalidLayoutException
Returns a reader specification for a column encoded using Avro, and decoded with the specific API using a given SpecificRecord generated class.

Parameters:
readerSchemaClass - Class of the specific record to decode.
Returns:
a reader specification for a column encoded using Avro, and decoded with the specific API using the given SpecificRecord generated class.
Throws:
InvalidLayoutException - if the specified class is not a valid Avro container class.

public ColumnReaderSpec.AvroReaderSchemaType getAvroReaderSchemaType()

getAvroReaderSchema

public org.apache.avro.Schema getAvroReaderSchema()
Returns the explicit Avro reader schema to use to decode the column.

Returns:
the explicit Avro reader schema to use to decode the column. Null if the master encoding is not Avro, or if the reader schema type is not explicit.

getAvroReaderSchemaClass

public Class<? extends org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificRecord> getAvroReaderSchemaClass()
Returns the class of the SpecificRecord to use to decode the column.

Returns:
the class of the SpecificRecord to use to decode the column. Null if the master encoding is not Avro, or if the reader schema type is not explicit, or if using the generic API.
